New Records: Glenn Maxwell hit the fastest century (106 off 40 balls) in World Cup history.
David Warner scored his second successive ton in the tournament.
Australia's win by 309 runs is the largest margin in World Cup history.
Mitchell Starc and Adam Zampa contributed significantly with their wickets.
Key Match Events: Glenn Maxwell's rapid century was a turning point.
David Warner and Steve Smith formed a significant partnership.
Mitchell Starc took crucial wickets, including a hat-trick in the warm-up match.
Netherlands' strong lower-middle order posed a threat.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia won the toss and chose to bat first.
Netherlands had a strong lower-middle order, a key strength in the tournament.
Australia's Power Play performance was a concern, as they went wicketless thrice in the opening Power Play.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Smith and David Warner's partnership was crucial.
Mitchell Marsh's early dismissal was a key moment.
Glenn Maxwell's performance was a highlight, and his century was the fastest in World Cup history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Arun Jaitley Stadium, known for its batter-friendly pitch.
The weather was favorable, with no rain and high temperatures.
The match was broadcast live on Star Sports and Disney+Hotstar.
Others: Mitchell Starc needed 2 wickets to surpass Lasith Malinga in wicket-taking rankings.
Travis Head's return was anticipated, with Mitchell Marsh filling in until then.
The Netherlands' skipper Scott Edwards had a unique background, having grown up in Australia.
